sections.heading: Before an Earthquake
items: Secure heavy furniture, water heaters, and appliances to walls.
Store breakables in low cabinets with latches.
Prepare an emergency kit and family communication plan.
Know how to turn off gas, electricity, and water if instructed.
Practice Drop, Cover, and Hold On drills.

sections.heading: During an Earthquake
items: Drop, Cover, and Hold On: get under sturdy furniture, protect your head and neck.
Stay indoors until shaking stops and itâ€™s safe to exit.
If outdoors, move away from buildings, streetlights, and utility wires.
If in a vehicle, pull over to a clear area and stop.
Expect aftershocks; be ready to Drop, Cover, and Hold On again.

sections.heading: After an Earthquake
items: Check for injuries; apply first aid and call for help if needed.
Inspect for gas leaks, damaged wiring, and water line breaks.
Use text messages or social media to communicate; keep phone lines clear.
Listen to authorities for updates and potential tsunami warnings.
Be cautious of debris, broken glass, and unstable structures.
